alert.note: Alert for Fayette (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 09 at 4:35PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Marshall and southwestern Fayette Counties through 500 PM CDT... At 435 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Mt Pleasant, or 10 miles southeast of Collierville, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Mt Pleasant, Macon, Piperton, Rossville, Taska, Cayce, Kirk, Elba, Hays Crossing, Canadaville and Hickory Withe. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
